body:
the patch is in stable5 branch 2268596e1a3cb305bc3092394e59d5fdc72f0c1b
@blizzz you have any idea?
for the record, i am showing this behavior on two different workstations in regular and private browsing mode for both firefox 19.0.2 and chrome 25.0.126.172.
@k4k did you configure one or more ldap server connections?

i have only one primary configured and one backup configured. please see the screenshots below for more information (sensitive information redacted)
![oc-ldap-basic](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/524645/282199/b6eda312-918a-11e2-923a-ddd30dc3371c.png)
![oc-ldap-advanced](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/524645/282200/b9bc6b82-918a-11e2-9250-a15ca2cdf615.png)
i cannot reproduce the php messages, but i could reproduce the behaviour, which ought to be fixed with https://github.com/owncloud/core/pull/2593
actually, the notices ain't be thrown on the users page, sharing is uninvolved there.

@blizzz i would like to add that when using the ldap users backend, the loginname still shows the uuid of the user instead of a readable name in admin -> users.
the displayname is actually correct (this was fixed in 5.0 > 5.0.2).

i am using a windows 2003 sbs server with the samaccountname attribute as uid.

internal owncloud-users are displayed with the correct loginname.

logging in using the textual loginname actually works, also with the webclient service in windows.

if i can do any more digging or if you need more information, please let me know.

regarding the server:

web server: 
apache/2.2.22 (linux/suse)

database:
mysql 5.5.28 - source distribution

php version:
5.3.15 (with apc)

owncloud version:
5.0.2 with the fscache missing table patch applied from github

webbrowser:
mozilla/5.0 (x11; linux x86_64; rv:12.0) gecko/20100101 firefox/12.0
@blizzz this appears to be resolved as of 5.0.3, cheers
@hcderaad it is intended behaviour.loginname == owncloud-internal username.
